intro: Trichomanes breynii, commonly known as the mountain holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its spores are produced in small, clustered structures called sori, which are located on the undersides of the fronds. Trichomanes breynii is notable for its ability to grow on rocky substrates and in epiphytic conditions, showcasing its adaptability to various microhabitats.
